attributes.comment:
I firmly oppose an increase in fees for the naturalization and immigration
processes. The fee increase will greatly affect so many that are already struggling
to make it in this country. It is unfortunate that so many barriers are placed on
those who are genuine about making this country great. I am a permanent resident
and a low-income college student. Given the alarming increase in costs to attend
a "public" university and the inavailability of financial aid, I struggle to pay my
tuition every quarter and face the uncertainty of finishing my college degree. I want
to become a citizen, but now it is ever more difficult. An increase in the fees would
have me facing a harsh dilemma. I can either pay for school and not become a
U.S. Citizen, or I can "drop-out" of school temporarily and apply to be naturalized.
Please take into consideration students like myself and so many others who do
not share the priviliges I have as a college student. I hope this proposal is haulted
immediately. Thank you for your time and consideration.
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Elizabeth Cortez
